unit_learning_outcomes.description: Devise a research proposal or practical resource targeting a question of interest
Demonstrate critical thinking and knowledge synthesis;

Demonstrate skill in undertaking and reporting reviews of the literature and in applying research results to professional practice with individuals who are deaf/hard of hearing or blind/have low vision;
Analyse key issues, research literature, and/or practical initiatives in an area of interest (education, therapy or service approach) relating to individuals with sensory disability;

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MDisabilityStud and 20cp from SPED8909-SPED8935 and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Present a research proposal or practical application based on research. (2000 words)
Provide a detailed literature review of the chosen research topic. (2000 words)

data.subject_search_title: SPED8912 - Independent Project in Sensory Disability
data.description: The unit is intended for students interested in studying a specialised topic with the close direction of a Master of Disability Studies Unit Convenor. This is an advanced course with flexible goals and assessments organised around an individual project. Consent of the unit convener is required prior to enrolling and approval is contingent on available supervision.
data.search_title: SPED8912 - Independent Project in Sensory Disability
